TopicTitle: Top Gun AI - The Official Tournament Thread

Articles.Content: Yeah, it's the 19th now.
So I've been trying to get in on this for a while, but I always forget.![SimpleUnhealthyAppaloosa.gif](https://giant.gfycat.com/SimpleUnhealthyAppaloosa.gif)
I was also thinking that I could write a kOS script to get them into starting positions if you guys want.

> 
>

> 
> 
> Is this competition still on?
> 

~~My computer has **finally** been fixed after approximately **nineteen** days of being either completely unusable, or in the ever-swift-to-fix hands of GeekSquad.  I just have to film the tournament now and it will **finally** be done with and ready for your viewing pleasure.~~ 

EDIT: Assuming they **actually** fixed it, that is. 

EDIT 2: Which it turns out they didn't.

> On 19-2-2016 at 6:32 PM, clown\_baby said:
> 
> 
> I was also thinking that I could write a kOS script to get them into starting positions if you guys want.

Good idea, this thread needs some serious work btw...

Bahamuto has introduced a competition mode in BDA. Moving planes into starting positions no longer matters, they fly apart to a preset distance then turn and engage. He specifically was thinking of us and the BAD-T competition.
[I've made some slight revisions to my hybrid fighter-heavy bomber.](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0Bz8ksGB7j0xmdU1qdkFFWjBZb0U/view?usp=sharing) It should still be within tourney legality

Here's an example of the competition mode.

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/_6-H7SyMMOc?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

~~Tournament is still on.  The lovely Doctor Davinci has volunteered to film the process on his rig, which I am incapable of doing.  I have spent the past few days attempting to run it on my computer, using a time warp control mod to set physics warp to 0.1 and then accelerating the footage in post-production, but decided this would not be possible as the game can not handle running itself, the four planes, and the recording software simultaneously without an extremely high risk of crashing.  It was further frustrated by the fact that attempting to perform good camera work at 10% speed was impossible for me, and I calculated that to film the entire thing, all the way through, at 10% speed would take **29** hours in total (5 minutes for each match at regular speed would be 50 minutes for each at 10% speed, 5 matches per round, 7 rounds in total).~~ 

~~I've therefore decided it would be best to let Davinci film the whole thing, which he has kindly volunteered to do.  I hope that you will enjoy his production, and that the entire thing can be completed before March as per the deadline described in the rules post on Page 51.~~ 

Never mind. 

**The tournament is not dead yet.** 

**Edited <time datetime="2016-02-26T08:15:47Z" title="02/26/2016 08:15  AM" data-short="8 yr">February 26, 2016</time> by CreativeCombat**

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, CreativeCombat said:
> 
> 
> Tournament is still on.  The lovely Doctor Davinci has volunteered to film the process on his rig, which I am incapable of doing.  I have spent the past few days attempting to run it on my computer, using a time warp control mod to set physics warp to 0.1 and then accelerating the footage in post-production, but decided this would not be possible as the game can not handle running itself, the four planes, and the recording software simultaneously without an extremely high risk of crashing.  It was further frustrated by the fact that attempting to perform good camera work at 10% speed was impossible for me, and I calculated that to film the entire thing, all the way through, at 10% speed would take **29** hours in total (5 minutes for each match at regular speed would be 50 minutes for each at 10% speed, 5 matches per round, 7 rounds in total). 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I've therefore decided it would be best to let Davinci film the whole thing, which he has kindly volunteered to do.  I hope that you will enjoy his production, and that the entire thing can be completed before March as per the deadline described in the rules post on Page 51. 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **The tournament is not dead yet.**
> 

**CORRECTION:**

I had offered previously and was refused the opportunity. It was only within the past few days that I was asked if I was willing to record like I had offered previously.

I only offered to record the fights due to everyone who had entered the competition wants to see the results, plain and simple. However, due to the constraints I have been asked to perform under, I know for a fact that I will not enjoy the experience and have to decline the opportunity to record the tournament at this time (being answerable to someone for a 'poor recording performance' or 'bad camera angle' is not why I offered to record the fights in the first place let alone I have no intention of taking a course on cinematography or any other such nonsense as was suggested to me)

I apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused  

Regards,

Doctor Davinci

**Edited <time datetime="2016-02-26T08:14:27Z" title="02/26/2016 08:14  AM" data-short="8 yr">February 26, 2016</time> by DoctorDavinci**

I'd like to continue this in a new form: **Fighter challenge**.

The format is simple, challenge us by uploading a fighter and we will try to shoot it down.

Use of mods and weapons can be decided by the challenger, remember we can use them to...

There can be only one, the best fighter jet will get his name and picture in the first post untill defeated.

Anyone up for this ? Are there still fighters ?

That thing is nasty !

Hard 2 beat ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif ":cool:")

Yeah, getting some planes from this thread to fight on my own... ![^_^](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_happy.png "^_^")

The newest version of BDArmory should not be used for this tournament yet. Why?

The update makes the GAU-8's 30mm rounds distance-fuzed; they explode after travelling a certain distance. Yeah, we're gonna need an evaluation as to whether the GAU-8 should be allowed in this form.

In addition, because I'm the only one crazy enough to use mk3 parts on a fighter, I've also noticed that mk3 cargo bays are now bullet proof to 20 mm vulcan bullets. And when I mean bullet proof, I mean they bounce off. Mk3 fuel tanks and cockpits still explode after a few hits, however.

Check out my discussion thread. I proposed this format as a 'King of the Hill' contest. It deserves a new thread, but you might want to think about constraints - no turrets, points limits etc. Note that BDA is getting lots of updates right now which impact AI behaviour, so designs may fluctuate wildly in their effectiveness. In a KOTH contest, that's just how the cookie crumbles.

Even though the outcome could be unfair, it's still more fun then not fighting at all. ![^_^](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_happy.png "^_^")

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, NotAnAimbot said:
> 
> 
> Is FAR required?
> 

FAR is not used in this competition. Keep in mind however that this tournament will be held with an older version of BDArmory (I think version 0.9.9.1) because the newest versions of BDA (0.10.x and above) have introduced many changes that need to be evaluated for balance.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, NotAnAimbot said:
> 
> 
> Are Chaff and Flare countermeasures permitted and handled by the AI?
> 

The (current) tournament is a gunfighting tournament, so you can technically spam as many CM's as you want because they won't do anything other than weigh your aircraft down ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)").

In tournaments with missiles involved, CM's are allowed and generally count towards a point system, whether it be the point system mentioned in the OP, or a custom set of rules. And yes, they will be automatically used by the pilot AI when it deems it necessary to do so.

If you would like to read the rules for the current dogfighting competition if you haven't read them already (which has yet to take place due to the host having computer problems), look on page 51 of this thread.
